channel.title: How to install Linux Ubuntu Or boot from cd
channel.description:
Just installed it with Xp so i might as well share it with you :D If only booting from cd goto 1-5 then to 9 and don't click the install icon. 1.First download Ubuntu [url=http://www.ubuntu.com/products/GetUbuntu]http://www.ubuntu.com/products/GetUbuntu[/url].
2.To burn the ISO image, download and install ImgBurn http://imgburn.com/ , a free image burning program.
4.Insert a blank CD in the drive and select Do nothing or Cancel if an autorun dialog pops up.
5.Right click on the ISO image you downloaded and select Burn with Imgburn. Click the Write Disc button and wait for the CD to finish burning.
6.Download Partion Manger ftp://pm2005:paragon05@ftp.vnudownloads.co.uk/paragon_pm2005_esd_eng.exe Serial is attached.
7.Make a new partion for Ubuntu.
8.If your bios arnt set to boot from Cd first set them too.
9.Let Ubuntu Boot, then select something along the lines of install of start Ubuntu
10.After that click the icon install then choose the place then select the partioned harddrive letter and let it install

item.dc:creator: @Taylor Taylor
item.description:
@Taylor wrote:

I suggest you use GParted LIvecd or gparted liveusb. :).

for laptops bios. press F12 when your computer boots with the ubuntu livecd in. then choose your cd drive.

edit: by the way, what with the attachment?

Just installed it with Xp so i might as well share it with you
If only booting from cd goto 1-5 then to 9 and donâ€™t click the install icon.
1.First download Ubuntu http://www.ubuntu.com/products/GetUbuntu.

2.To burn the ISO image, download and install ImgBurn http://imgburn.com/ , a free image burning
program.

4.Insert a blank CD in the drive and select Do nothing or Cancel if an autorun dialog pops up.

5.Right click on the ISO image you downloaded and select Burn with Imgburn.
Click the Write Disc button and wait for the CD to finish burning.

6.Download Partion Manger ftp://pm2005:paragon05@ftp.vnudownloads.co.uk/paragon_pm2005_esd_eng.exe Serial is attached.

7.Make a new partion for Ubuntu.

8.If your bios arnt set to boot from Cd first set them too.

9.Let Ubuntu Boot, then select something along the lines of install of start Ubuntu

10.After that click the icon install then choose the place then select the partioned harddrive letter and let it install
